meanings.definition: A South American shrub or small tree with compound leaves and clusters of small white or pink flowers.
meanings.sent1: The rhatanies in the garden have beautiful pink flowers.
meanings.sent2: I learned about rhatanies in my science class.
meanings.sent3: The rhatanies in the park always make me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her garden is a colorful canvas, with rhatanies adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The rhatanies swayed gently in the breeze, a peaceful sight.

meanings.definition: The dried root of the rhatany, used in medicine and dyeing.
meanings.sent1: She used rhatanies to create natural dyes for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The rhatanies were carefully harvested for their medicinal properties.
meanings.sent3: The rhatanies in the apothecary shop smelled earthy and comforting.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of rhatanies was the foundation of his herbal remedies.
meanings.sent5: The ancient texts praised the healing powers of rhatanies.

meanings.definition: A reddish-brown dye obtained from the rhatany root.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was dyed using rhatanies, giving it a warm hue.
meanings.sent2: Artisans prized the vibrant color produced by rhatanies.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled rhatanies on her apron, creating a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with shades reminiscent of rhatanies.
meanings.sent5: The painter mixed rhatanies with other pigments to achieve the perfect shade.
